Trial_Design.evidence: randomized controlled study of temporary BiVP after cardiopulmonary bypass

Participants.evidence: Cardiac surgical patients at risk of left ventricular failure after cardiopulmonary bypass.

Intervention.evidence: Temporary BiVP was optimized immediately after cardiopulmonary bypass.

Objective.evidence: Objectives: Atrioventricular conduction prolongation (AVCP) in cardiac pacing is measurable and results primarily from delayed atrial conduction.

Method_Outcome.evidence: For each patient the AVCP and the pAVD producing the optimum (highest) cardiac output (OptCO) and mean arterial pressure (OptMAP) were determined.

Number_Analysed.evidence: short-AVCP group (<64 ms, n = 3), AVCP, OptCO, and OptMAP were 40 ± 11, 120 ± 0, and 150 ± 30 ms, respectively, and for the long-AVCP group (>64 ms, n = 4)

Result_Outcome.evidence: OptCO and OptMAP were significantly less in the short-AVCP group ( p = 0.015 and p = 0.029, respectively).
